text.p: Suppose [mathjaxinline]A = \left[ \begin{array}{ccc} 0& 2 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 & 2 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]B = \left[ \begin{array}{cccc} 1& 1& 2 & -1 \\ 1 & 4 & 3 & 2 \end{array} \right].[/mathjaxinline] Click all of the following expressions which are defined.

font.p: The only things we need to pay attention to are the sizes of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]B[/mathjaxinline]; we see that [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is [mathjaxinline]2\times 3[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]B[/mathjaxinline] is [mathjaxinline]2\times 4[/mathjaxinline]. Hence [mathjaxinline]AB[/mathjaxinline] is not defined, nor is [mathjaxinline]BA[/mathjaxinline], and hence not [mathjaxinline](BA)^ t[/mathjaxinline]. [mathjaxinline]A^ t[/mathjaxinline] is [mathjaxinline]3\times 2[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]B^ t[/mathjaxinline] is [mathjaxinline]4\times 2[/mathjaxinline], so [mathjaxinline]B^ tA[/mathjaxinline] is defined but [mathjaxinline]BA^ t[/mathjaxinline] is not, nor is [mathjaxinline]B^ tA^ t[/mathjaxinline].

Finally, [mathjaxinline]BB^ t[/mathjaxinline] is [mathjaxinline]2\times 2[/mathjaxinline], as is [mathjaxinline]AA^ t[/mathjaxinline]. Therefore [mathjaxinline]BB^ tAA^ t[/mathjaxinline] is also [mathjaxinline]2\times 2[/mathjaxinline] and can be cubed.
